reviews.review_msg: I loved every aspect of the course. The reading materials, course structure and the discussion forum. Prof. Allan has a very flexible approach and he is a very understanding person.

Was excited to take the course based on reviews. Not sure if it's just this semester, but I really wish I didn't take it - or that I took it in class. Instructions for the assignments are so incredibly vague. Seriously, no indication of what the TAs are looking for. My academic writing is quite strong, but this course has been a nightmare so far

This was a distance education class, where your TA mainly runs the course. The class was fairly easy, though it can be time consuming and the instructions were not always clear. It is 50% portfolios and 50% group discussions, where you write 500 words for each, and no exams. If you can write an APA formatted essay, it is a GPA booster.

It's online so it's more about the TA; you never even meet Allan. 50% weekly portfolios of 500 words, 50% online dicussion. It's 1h worth of work per week. If you can write a basic essay with citations you'll get an A

Relatively easy and straightforward course. The course is composed 50/50 of short writing assignments and discussions which are due every week. The reading material is very accessible and simple, and the writing assignments and discussions are clearly laid out. I would recommend taking this course online, as I can't imagine in-person is as easy.
I found this class quite boring, but it was super easy, took very little time each weekm and fulfilled my humanities requirement so I don't regret taking it.
Very boring. Not the GPA boost it's mad up to be. Very long and tedious readings. No structure. Pass on this course and take it in class

Have heard AMAZING things about this prof and class HOWEVER the ONLINE/DISTANCE ED version of this class is HORRIBLE. This course was difficult and EXTREMELY time consuming. Look elsewhere for an elective or take it in-class

Allan is a wonderful prof, I cannot stress how great of a person he is. He's so chill and helpful and all of the assignments (paper/portfolio and a presentation) were so flexible; he lets you use your creativity. The other parts of the course were online discussions on canvas, so easy! Plus, no final! Take educ 100 with him!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. It was a huge mistake. I took it online and my friend took it in-class both with Mackinnon and she loved him. But the online version was quite poorly done. Very difficult, unclear and no direction whereas in-class was the opposite. If you are going to take it online swap to something else... trust me
Great man to take upper division classes with but EDUC 100 was not as good as I expected. Material and text were hard to understand, assignments were long and boring, I would definetely not recommend
Best professor I've ever had at SFU... He'll go any length to help you, no matter what your problem is. Extremely down to Earth individual. Words cannot describe how great this man is.
This course was one of the most useful courses I took at SFU. I learned a lot about science and teaching. Allan was a very helpful, interesting instructor who obviously loves his work.

Very nice prof.  Practices what he believes about education.  Tries very hard to instill a sense of wonder in our world and helps us to see we can do that too with our students.  You will come out with lots of unit plans as these are shared among groups.
